info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 6:38PM MDT until June 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. .Periods of heavy rain falling on a deep primed snowpack will cause continued melting and increasing river flows. Rivers will rise rapidly and reach critical levels. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM MDT Sunday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise back above flood stage this evening, then peak near 10.9 feet by noon Monday. It is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday night. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 06/09/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Belfry 9.0 8.9 Sun 4 pm 9.8 7.8 6.6 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 1230 PM MDT.
